scope: 7 pathologies - evidence-based JSON for patient website integration

sources.org: European Position Paper on Rhinosinusitis and Nasal Polyps (EPOS)
sources.title_short: EPOS 2020 Executive Summary
EPOS 2020 - Chronic Rhinosinusitis Management
EPOS 2020 - Full Text Fokkens et al.

videos.title: Nasal Saline Irrigation Technique
videos.why_this: Practical demonstration of first-line treatment (nasal irrigation) per EPOS 2020 evidence
videos.safety_note: Use isotonic saline (0.9%), body-temperature water. Avoid excessive pressure.

videos.title: Sinus Rinse Technique - Step by Step
videos.why_this: Educational video from medical institution demonstrating proper irrigation technique
videos.safety_note: Never use hot water. Technique important to avoid otitis media.

shock_but_true.claim: Antibiotics rarely help acute viral rhinosinusitis - most cases resolve within 2 weeks without treatment
Nasal saline irrigation (plain water/salt) is as effective as intranasal corticosteroids for mild-moderate CRS

sources.title_short: EULAR revised recommendations for fibromyalgia management
Effect of different types of exercise in fibromyalgia (meta-analysis)
Role of Exercise in Fibromyalgia Management - 2024 Systematic Review Update

videos.title: 20-minute Low Intensity Cardio Exercise for Fibromyalgia
videos.why_this: Dr. Andrea Furlan (30 years chronic pain specialist) demonstrates EULAR-recommended aerobic exercise progression
videos.safety_note: Start at exertion level 5-6/10. Stop if pain persists >30 min post-exercise. Gradual progression over weeks.

videos.title: Understanding Fibromyalgia and Psychological Symptoms
videos.why_this: Educational overview linking EULAR evidence on central sensitization and cognitive-behavioral approaches
videos.safety_note: Not a substitute for professional evaluation; consult physician for diagnosis.

thermal_evidence.title: Balneotherapy for Fibromyalgia - Systematic Review & Meta-analysis
thermal_evidence.note: Moderate evidence: 3-week thermal cure reduces pain (SMD -1.67, 95% CI -2.18 to -1.16), benefits persist 1-6 months.

shock_but_true.claim: Aerobic exercise, resistance training, and stretching ALL equally effective for fibromyalgia pain reduction (no 'best' type)
Cognitive-behavioral therapy shows stronger evidence than medication for long-term fibromyalgia improvement
Low-intensity exercise (starting below usual fitness threshold) more effective than high-intensity for fibromyalgia

sources.title_short: ESVS 2024 Clinical Practice Guidelines - Peripheral Arterial Disease
Balneotherapy for Chronic Venous Insufficiency - Systematic Review
New ESVS Practice Guidelines for Intermittent Claudication

videos.title: Chronic Venous Insufficiency (CVI) - Symptoms, Causes & Treatments
videos.why_this: UC Davis Health institutional video by vascular surgeon on evidence-based CVI management
videos.safety_note: Compression therapy and regular walking are first-line. Seek vascular surgery if ulceration develops.

videos.title: Chronic Venous Insufficiency: What Your Legs Are Trying to Tell You
videos.why_this: Dermatologist-led overview of CVI warning signs and evidence-based prevention strategies
videos.safety_note: Early recognition prevents progression to ulceration. Compression therapy essential.

thermal_evidence.title: Balneotherapy for Chronic Venous Insufficiency - RCT
thermal_evidence.note: 3-week thermal spa therapy improves QoL, symptom burden; benefits persist 6-12 months. Moderate evidence.

shock_but_true.claim: Compression therapy (20-30 mmHg) is first-line treatment and as effective as many surgeries for mild-moderate CVI
Regular walking (not bed rest) is essential - immobility worsens venous hypertension and ulcer risk
CVI affects ~1 in 3 adults but <10% progress to ulceration with early compression therapy

sources.title_short: EULAR 2023 recommendations - hip and knee osteoarthritis non-pharmacological management
Exercise for osteoarthritis of the knee - Cochrane systematic review
Comparison of five exercise treatment regimens for primary knee OA - network meta-analysis

sources.org: Australian Commission on Safety and Quality
sources.title_short: Osteoarthritis of the Knee Clinical Care Standard 2024

videos.title: Knee Osteoarthritis - Quadriceps Strengthening Exercises
videos.why_this: CHRU Nancy institutional video (CUMSAPA program) demonstrating EULAR-recommended quadriceps strengthening
videos.safety_note: Start without resistance. Progress gradually over 8-12 weeks. Pain should decrease, not increase.

videos.title: Knee Osteoarthritis Management - Full Exercise Program
videos.why_this: CHU Rouen comprehensive lower limb strengthening and balance (appropriate for knee OA + fall prevention)
videos.safety_note: Balance exercises important for seniors. Use support if needed. Combine with aerobic activity.

thermal_evidence.title: Balneotherapy for Knee Osteoarthritis - French Multicenter Study (THERMATHROSE)
thermal_evidence.note: 3-week thermal cure + physiotherapy superior to standard care alone; pain reduction 48-71%, benefits >9 months.

shock_but_true.claim: Weight loss of just 5 kg reduces knee pain by ~50% (4 kg weight loss = 16 kg decompression per step)
Aquatic exercise (pool walking) is as effective as land exercise but better tolerated by patients
No single exercise 'best' - rotating walking, strengthening, stretching prevents adaptation plateau

sources.title_short: WHO Guideline for non-surgical management of chronic primary low back pain
Chronic Low Back Pain - Narrative Review of Recent Clinical Practice Guidelines
Cognitive Behavioral Therapy for Chronic Low Back Pain - Cochrane Review

videos.title: Chronic Low Back Pain - Core Stabilization Exercises
videos.why_this: CHRU Tours institutional video on progressive core strengthening per WHO 2023 biopsychosocial approach
videos.safety_note: Start supine. Progress to standing over weeks. Combine with aerobic activity (walking) and education.

videos.title: Low Back Pain - Multimodal Management (Exercise + Mindfulness)
videos.why_this: Educational overview integrating exercise + relaxation per WHO recommendation for integrated care
videos.safety_note: WHO recommends biopsychosocial approach - exercise alone insufficient. Add education + psychological support.

thermal_evidence.title: Thermal Cure for Chronic Low Back Pain - HAS / French Studies
thermal_evidence.note: 19 RCTs: 16 show durable improvement. Pain reduction 48-71%, medication use -40-58%, benefits 3-9 months.

shock_but_true.claim: Imaging (X-ray, MRI) does NOT improve outcomes and increases unnecessary treatment & anxiety
Exercise beats medication for long-term chronic low back pain relief per WHO 2023 meta-analysis
Stay active (modified work/walking) superior to bed rest - fear-avoidance creates deconditioning cycle

sources.org: Global Initiative for Chronic Obstructive Lung Disease (GOLD)
sources.title_short: GOLD 2025 Pocket Guide - COPD Management
GOLD 2023 Report - Global Initiative for COPD
Pulmonary Rehabilitation in COPD - Evidence and Best Practices

videos.title: Efficacy of Supervised Maintenance Exercise Following Pulmonary Rehabilitation
videos.why_this: Dove Medical Press - video abstract of 8-trial meta-analysis: maintenance exercise reduces hospital admission 38-40%
videos.safety_note: Pulmonary rehabilitation FIRST (8-12 weeks supervised), then maintenance. Monitor oxygen saturation if needed.

videos.title: COPD Management - Evidence-Based Pulmonary Rehabilitation
videos.why_this: GOLD/WHO institutional overview on exercise, smoking cessation, and vaccination per 2025 guidelines
videos.safety_note: Smoking cessation is ONLY intervention that slows FEV1 decline. Exercise alone insufficient without cessation.

shock_but_true.claim: Pulmonary rehabilitation (exercise + education) superior to inhalers alone for exacerbation prevention
Supervised maintenance exercise after rehab reduces hospital admission by 38% vs usual care alone
Smoking cessation is ONLY intervention that alters disease trajectory (FEV1 decline) in COPD

sources.title_short: AAP - Management of Acute Otitis Media in Children
Recurrent Otitis Media - Evidence and Prevention Strategies
Otitis Media in Children - Risk Factors and Prevention

videos.title: Prevention of Recurrent Otitis Media in Children
videos.why_this: AAP institutional educational video on risk factors (tobacco smoke, allergies, daycare) and vaccination
videos.safety_note: Breastfeeding protective. Avoid supine bottle feeding. Minimize secondhand smoke exposure.

videos.title: Acute Otitis Media - Diagnosis and Initial Management
videos.why_this: Pediatric institutional video on when antibiotics needed vs observation per AAP guidelines
videos.safety_note: Watch & wait acceptable if age >2 yrs, mild symptoms, reliable follow-up. Antibiotics if fever/severe pain.

shock_but_true.claim: Secondhand smoke increases recurrent otitis risk 3-fold; single intervention with highest evidence
Breastfeeding ≥6 months reduces otitis recurrence by ~50% vs formula alone
Daycare attendance (>10 children) increases risk OR~3; minimal risk with <5 children per group
